description: Triangle of Euler-Bernoulli or Entringer numbers read by rows.
comments: Zig-Zag numbers (see the Conway and Guy reference p. 110 and the J.-P. Delahaye reference, p. 31).Approximation to Pi: 2*n*a(n-1,n-1)/a(n,n), n>=3. See A132049(n)/A132050(n). See the Delahaye reference, p. 31.
references: J. H. Conway and R. K. Guy, The Book of Numbers, New York: Springer-Verlag, p. 110.
J.-P. Delahaye, Pi - die Story (German translation), Birkhaeuser, 1999 Basel, p. 31. French original: Le fascinant nombre Pi, Pour la Science, Paris, 1997.
links: Vincenzo Librandi and Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140 (rows n = 0..43 from Vincenzo Librandi)
V. I. Arnold, Bernoulli-Euler updown numbers associated with function singularities, their combinatorics and arithmetics, Duke Math. J. 63 (1991), 537-555.

V. I. Arnold, The calculus of snakes and the combinatorics of Bernoulli, Euler and Springer numbers of Coxeter groups, Uspekhi Mat. nauk., 47 (#1, 1992), 3-45 = Russian Math. Surveys, Vol. 47 (1992), 1-51.
M. Josuat-Verges, J.-C. Novelli and J.-Y. Thibon, The algebraic combinatorics of snakes, arXiv preprint arXiv:1110.5272, 2011
J. Millar, N. J. A. Sloane and N. E. Young, A new operation on sequences: the Boustrophedon on transform, J. Combin. Theory, 17A 44-54 1996 (Abstract, pdf, ps).
C. Poupard, De nouvelles significations enumeratives des nombres d'Entringer, Discrete Math., 38 (1982), 265-271.
formula: a(0,0)=1, a(n,m)=0 if n<m, a(n,m)=0 if m<0 else Sum_{k=1..m} a(n-1,n-k).
example: This version of the triangle begins:             1           0   1         0   1   1       0   1   2   2     0   2   4   5   5   0   5  10  14  16  16See A008280 and A108040 for other versions.
maple: A008281 := proc(h,k) option remember ;    if h=1 and k=1 or h=0 then        RETURN(1) ;    elif h>=1 and k> h then        RETURN(0) ;    elif h=k then        RETURN( procname(h,h-1)) ;    else        RETURN( add(procname(h-1,j),j=h-k..h-1) ) ;    fi ;end: # _R. J. Mathar_, Nov 27 2006
